QStream – Working with quantum datastreams¶

class squanch.qstream.QStream(systemSize, numSystems, array=None, reformatArray=False)[source]¶

Efficiently handle a large number of small entangled quantum systems to avoid having to perform many class instantiations when simulating transmission of data through quantum channels

__init__(systemSize, numSystems, array=None, reformatArray=False)[source]¶

Instantiate the quantum datastream object

Parameters:
  • systemSize (int) – number of entangled qubits in each quantum system; each system has dimension 2^systemSize
  • numSystems (int) – number of small quantum systems in the data stream
  • array (np.array) – pre-allocated array in memory for purposes of sharing QStreams in multiprocessing
__module__ = 'squanch.qstream'¶
classmethod fromArray(array, reformatArray=False)[source]¶

Instantiates a quantum datastream object from a (typically shared) pre-allocated array

Parameters:
  • array (np.array) – the pre-allocated np.complex64 array representing the shared Hilbert space
  • reformatArray (bool) – if providing a pre-allocated array, whether to reformat it to the all-zero state
Returns:

the child QStream
head()[source]¶

Access the “head” of the quantum system “queue”, returning it as a QSystem object, and increment the head by 1

Returns:a QSystem for the “head” system
static reformatArray(array)[source]¶

Reformats a Hilbert space array in-place to the all-zero state

Parameters:array (np.array) – a numSystems x 2^systemSize x 2^systemSize array of np.complex64 values
system(index)[source]¶

Access the nth quantum system in the quantum datastream object

Parameters:index (int) – zero-index of the quantum system to access
Returns:the quantum system
squanch.qstream.allZeroState(systemSize, numSystems)[source]¶

Generate an array representing the numSystems Hilbert spaces in the state |0>...|0><0|...<0|

Parameters:
  • systemSize (int) – maximum size of entangled subsystems
  • numSystems (int) – number of disjoint quantum subsystems to allocate
Returns:

the all-zero state array
squanch.qstream.sharedHilbertSpace(systemSize, numSystems)[source]¶

Allocate a portion of shareable c-type memory to create a numpy array that is sharable between processes

Parameters:
  • systemSize (int) – number of entangled qubits in each quantum system; each system has dimension 2^systemSize
  • numSystems (int) – number of small quantum systems in the data stream
Returns:

a blank, sharable, numSystems x 2^systemSize x 2^systemSize array of np.complex64 values
